title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (Montreal, QC)
Interview Descriptions: Very precise and fun, a lot of friendly scenarios occurred in this process. Answer to the job was given relatively quick also. Additionally, there was no confusing by tasks and later compensation
Interview Questions: What are your current job environment expectations

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal
Interview Descriptions: it was more formal than expected it was more formal than expected it was more formal than expected it was more formal than expected it was more formal than expected it was more formal than expected
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us

title: Biomedical Engineering Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview with different embers of the staff, HR, engineering. Each of them asks you different questions. You get scenarios and you have to explain how you would react. You get questions on how a biomedical engineer leads his job.
Interview Questions: What do you think a biomedical engineer do in his daily job?

title: Assistant Recherche Clinique Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Questions personnelles.Tu as des enfants ? Combien? Quel âge?  Mise en situation. Comment gérer un conflict.en général des questions loin de la partie technique. Pas d'expérience demande dans le domaine
Interview Questions: Tu as des enfants ? Combien? Quel âge?

title: Agente adminstrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took a year or more. I interviewed at Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (Laval, QC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Première étape était de réussir trois tests d'embauche par écrit: une dictée, un questionnaire avec des termes médicaux, évaluation calculant le nombre de mots/minute sur l'ordinateur. 
En deuxième temps, une entrevue orale d'embauche avec 2 autres candidates et 2 interviewers.
Interview Questions: Si vous constatez qu'un employé vole, que faites-vous ?

title: Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (Montreal, QC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very methodic and applicable to the job at task. However, interview was biased towards experience and not si much towards proven results. Overall it was a lengthy process, but rewarding nonetheless.
Interview Questions: Data set analysis and how to decode it

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online in 2004
First interview is phone interview
then went in to do practical tests such as typing, filing in alpha numerical orders & grammar. 
You have 3 chances to do each test If I remember correctly.
then in person interview with HR and intern and a recruiter I think. Questions about your resume, where you see yourself in a couple of years, do you plan on going back to school etc. 
Go a call back about two weeks after final interview and was hired. You get one week in class training then 10 days shadowing someone. At the time they guaranteed I would do full time, but on orientation day the woman said and I quote ' we can not guarantee that you will work full time, we might not call you for 3 weeks". Which is scary but I ended up working on call full time for 6 years before applying and getting a full time position so dont panic!
Interview Questions: How would you react if you where faced with an agressive/screaming patient.
